meanings.definition: The action of arousing interest, enthusiasm, or excitement in someone.
meanings.sent1: The teacher used colorful visuals to provide stimulation in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The movie's thrilling plot provided great stimulation for the audience.
meanings.sent3: The surprise party was a delightful stimulation for the birthday girl.
meanings.sent4: The music festival was a sensory stimulation overload for the attendees.
meanings.sent5: The roller coaster ride offered an exhilarating stimulation to the riders.

meanings.definition: The process of making a part of the body or a nerve more active or sensitive.
meanings.sent1: Physical therapy aims to provide gentle stimulation to the injured muscles.
meanings.sent2: The massage therapist applied pressure for muscle stimulation.
meanings.sent3: The tickling sensation on his feet was an unexpected stimulation during the pedicure.
meanings.sent4: The acupuncture treatment focused on nerve stimulation to alleviate pain.
meanings.sent5: The warm bath provided a soothing stimulation to her tired body.

meanings.definition: The action of encouraging something to happen or develop.
meanings.sent1: Positive feedback can be a great source of motivation and stimulation.
meanings.sent2: The mentor's guidance served as a valuable stimulation for the project team.
meanings.sent3: The friendly competition between the siblings was a healthy stimulation for their growth.
meanings.sent4: The new initiative sparked a wave of economic stimulation in the community.
meanings.sent5: The challenging puzzle game offered mental stimulation for the players.
